title: ULA shooting for Sunday NROL-107 launch, last Atlas NRO mission
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) will try again Sunday to launch Atlas V with the classified NROL-107 Silent Barker mission set. The latest attempt comes after several days, including a rollback due to a hurricane threat.

title: Using new data analysis tool on Swift, scientists discover black hole snacking on a star
summary: Scientists, using NASA’s Neil Gehrels Swift Observatory, have discovered a black hole that is continuously snacking on a star that is similar to our Sun. Located in a galaxy around 500 million light-years away from Earth, the black hole’s constant nibbling on the star, a phenomenon known as a tidal disruption event, creates a bright burst of light. This burst of light subsequently lit up the galaxy, which allowed for its discovery.

title: Viasat researching more portable satcoms terminals for dismounted soldiers
summary: Viasat’s U.K. subsidiary is partnering with Oxford Space Systems, a British satellite antenna specialist, to develop a 50% lighter high-speed communications terminal to improve the mobility of dismounted soldiers.

title: Avio Financials Boosted by EU Covid Recovery Funds and Missile Contracts
summary:
Avio has reported revenues of €157.6 million for the first half of 2023, an increase of 17.7% from the same period last year. The company attributed the positive performance to increased development activities for its Recovery and Resilience Plan (RRP) projects, which are funded by EU Covid recovery funds, and production activities for tactical propulsion […]
The post Avio Financials Boosted by EU Covid Recovery Funds and Missile Contracts appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Virgin Galactic's Galactic 03 Mission Complete, Mystery Crew Revealed
summary: In a mission cloaked in secrecy akin to the classified operations of national security endeavors, Virgin Galactic successfully completed its third commercial suborbital spaceflight today (September 8, 2023).

title: Relativity Space Expands NASA Stennis Ops With Historic Test Stand Lease
summary: Relativity Space has officially announced a strategic agreement with NASA's Stennis Space Center to lease the historic A-2 test stand. The Apollo era test stand is set to be used in a significant role in the development of Relativity Space's Terran R rocket.

title: South Africa Formally Partners With China On Lunar Base
summary: South Africa has formally become a part of the China-led International Lunar Research Station Cooperation (ILRS).

title: FAA: Starship Mishap Investigation Complete, But No Flight Approval Yet
summary: The FAA announced today that its investigation into what went wrong on the first flight of SpaceX’s Starship rocket in April is done. SpaceX is ready to try again, but […]

title: Redwire Successfully 3D Prints Human Tissue in Microgravity Aboard the ISS & Returns It To Earth
summary: In a groundbreaking development for biotechnology applications and for the first time in history, a human body part has been successfully 3D-printing using human tissue in microgravity.

title: Virgin Galactic completes third commercial SpaceShipTwo flight
summary: Virgin Galactic performed its third commercial suborbital spaceflight Sept. 8 with three private astronauts on board.
